items.title: "An estimated 19,000 [asylum seekers] have been reported...
items.content_html:
Abolish ICE Denver

"An estimated 19,000 [asylum seekers] have been reported dead or missing in the Mediterranean Sea since 2014 as they attempt the treacherous boat journey from Libya to Europe, fleeing war, persecution and poverty.

Since its foundation in 2015, Spanish NGO Open Arms has rescued over 60,000 refugees. But nothing prepared it for the events that unfolded on November 1, 2020."

We join the ‚ÄòOpen Arms‚Äô crew as they embark on the most dangerous migrant route in the world ‚Äî and one of their deadliest missions to date.An estimated 19,00...

items.title: "When Westword asked GEO Group about Biden's January...
items.content_html:
Abolish ICE Denver

"When Westword asked GEO Group about Biden's January 26 executive order calling for the Department of Justice to phase out its use of private prisons, Pablo Paez, a vice president for the company, said that the order is a "solution in search of a problem" and that GEO Group has run "newer and more modern" facilities for the Bureau of Prisons for more than three decades.

Paez did not respond when asked whether GEO Group was concerned about a possible shift away from private prisons for immigrant detention; ICE declined to comment."

"Privately run facilities have failed to meet that standard."

westword.com

Crow Wants Biden to Stop Using Private Prisons for Immigrant Detention

"Privately run facilities have failed to meet that standard.""Privately run facilities have failed to meet that standard."

items.title: "Blanco, her husband, came to the U.S. in 2005 and lived...
items.content_html:
Abolish ICE Denver

"Blanco, her husband, came to the U.S. in 2005 and lived and worked in the country without legal status until 2011, when a car crash put him on federal authorities‚Äô radars. Ever since, he‚Äôs been fighting for a pathway to remain in the country and avoid deportation back to El Salvador.

It‚Äôs not uncommon for cases like his to take the better part of a decade. As people navigate the country‚Äôs complicated, constantly changing legal landscape, they‚Äôre usually granted permission to... work. Blanco was holding down a job at a restaurant until COVID-19 restrictions meant his hours whittled away to nothing. Though taxes from his wages paid into Colorado‚Äôs unemployment insurance system, his status meant he wasn‚Äôt allowed to benefit from that program. His family was also ineligible for the congressional stimulus checks issued last year.

The money he and Martinez make from the food they sell helps them feed their two children and stay engaged in Blanco‚Äôs case."

See MorePresident Biden's new direction on immigration is giving some hope as financial stability continues to drop beneath them.

denverite.com

Undocumented Denverites can't file for unemployment, so families got creative to keep the bills paid

President Biden's new direction on immigration is giving some hope as financial stability continues to drop beneath them.President Biden's new direction on immigration is giving some hope as financial stability continues to drop beneath them.

items.title: Today Joe Biden signed several executive orders. One was widely...
items.content_html:
Abolish ICE Denver

Today Joe Biden signed several executive orders. One was widely hailed as ‚Äúthe end of private prisons.‚Äù I saw major media organizations and leading political leaders literally tweet that Biden just issued an executive order ‚Äúending private prisons.‚Äù‚Å£
‚Å£
Except NO SUCH THING happened. ‚Å£
‚Å£
The overwhelming majority of private prisons are state-based. 100% of those private prisons will continue. ‚Å£...
‚Å£
But not only will 100% of city, county, and state based private prisons continue to operate, the majority of federal private prisons and detention centers, which are immigration detention centers, will continue as well. Biden‚Äôs executive order didn‚Äôt cover any of those. ‚Å£
‚Å£
About 8% of all incarcerated people are housed in private prisons. Most of those people will remain in private prisons. ‚Å£
‚Å£
92% of all incarcerated people are in public facilities. Worse, Biden‚Äôs executive order appears to impact only a microscopic amount of the already tiny percentage of people held in private prisons. ‚Å£
‚Å£
One expert today told me that Biden‚Äôs announcement would impact such a tiny percentage of people that he didn‚Äôt actually have a number for it ‚Äì because it‚Äôs less than half of a percent. And they are simply going to be moved to other prisons - not released. ‚Å£
‚Å£
This is performative change. It‚Äôs more than nothing, but at the same time somewhere in the ballpark of a half step above nothing. To actually confront this problem, it‚Äôs going to take a lot of more than this. ‚Å£
‚Å£
On the list of things that could be done, this doesn‚Äôt crack the top 25. It‚Äôs performative. Fluff. Nothing changes.

See More

items.title: It‚Äôs our last sale of the month! Two families will be working...
items.content_html:
Abolish ICE Denver

It‚Äôs our last sale of the month! Two families will be working together to make burritos, and the money will go toward an emergency fund, rather than the families cooking. The growth of this fund is incredibly important to the families who lead Sanctuary4All because it provides security in case anyone is unexpectedly detained and needs money quickly for legal representation. You can order a burrito at solidaritymeals.paperform.co

items.title: This New Year‚Äôs Eve, please join the @denvercommunists and other activists across the Colorado Front Range who have...
items.content_html:
This New Year’s Eve, please join the @denvercommunists and other activists across the Colorado Front Range who have organized a noise demonstration in solidarity with our incarcerated neighbors and political prisoners like anarchist, activist, and poet, Eric King.

What better way is there to show solidarity other than showing up, making some noise & closing out this shit show of a year together? Show up with your best NYE noise makers, demonstration banners and signs. Who knows, we may even try out a new flavor of Pig face? Fed or Jeffco anyone?

We are planning on meeting up at Harriman Lake Park at 7:30 pm at W Quincy Ave & S. Kipling Pkwy, then heading to the facility which is across the street at 9595 W Quincy Ave Littleton, CO 80123.

**Neither we, nor the other organizers of this action, are affiliated in any way with Eric King nor the Eric King Support team @SupportEricKing. We all just want to show some love and and we are happy to signal boost that!**

“I have been incredibly fortunate to have so many people come into my life and take a stand with me so that I didn’t have to face this shit alone… From the smallest greeting to the big gestures, everything has meant so much to me… Now that said, I stand by my actions... After seeing what happened in Ferguson, so close down the road, I was disgusted by the lack of mobilization in my city. Three hours away people were fighting for their lives and we weren’t even taking to the streets. We were doing nothing. My act as a very personal display of my anger and rage toward the state as well as an act of solidarity to everyone in Ferguson. We never know our own strength until we are tested and even with my ridiculous sentence I feel at least proud to have been able to stand strong and refuse to cooperate with the state. I am just really happy that I don’t have to take this alone and have so many amazing people standing next to me. Until all are free.”
— Eric King

https://unicornriot.ninja/2016/eric-king-given-10-yr-sentence-throwing-molotovs-empty-govt-building/

items.title: Join us Friday, December 18 at 7 p.m. for a premiere virtual screening of ‚ÄúThe Facility.‚Äù ...
items.content_html:
Join us Friday, December 18 at 7 p.m. for a premiere virtual screening of “The Facility.”

“The Facility” is a short documentary film chronicling the lived experiences of immigrants being held at the GEO detention facility in Aurora, Colorado. This film addresses the personal loss and consequences caused by for-profit detention and the federal government's broken immigration policies. Legal and medical experts highlight horrific abuses including death, medical neglect, nutrition issues, and prolonged detention during the coronavirus pandemic. To tell their stories, current and former detainees, families fighting to be reunited, and advocates come together to share their experiences behind the walls of the GEO immigration detention facility in Aurora.

@acluofcolorado @coloradopeoplesalliance @co_immigrant @keshagrijalva @_floodlight_

Following the screening will be a Q&A session with the director, legal experts, and individuals featured in the film with first-hand experience of the systemic abuse occurring inside the facility.

Panelists include:

Jeremy Flood, “The Facility” Director
Raul Medina Perez, COPA, Community Organizer who was formerly detained at GEO
Kesha Davalos Grijalva, Immigrant rights advocate whose husband is detained at GEO
Keinada Andereas, Colorado Student who was formerly detained at GEO
Hans Meyer, The Meyer Law Office, Lead Attorney
Denise Maes, ACLU of Colorado, Public Policy Director

Please RSVP for the screening in advance for this free event: https://aclu.zoom.us/webinar/register/WN_nUbTy8-VQpif8nMzqtUzQw

Trailer: https://youtu.be/cGOCejy48Jo

“The Facility” is presented by ACLU of Colorado, Colorado Immigrant Rights Coalition, and Colorado Hispanic Bar Association.
